did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: National Association of Science Writers and Council for the Advancement of Science Writing records, 1934-2018.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Records of the National Association of Science Writers and the Council for the Advancement of Science Writing include correspondence, membership records, financial records, domestic and international affairs material, newsletters, administrative material, working papers for seminars and workshops, samples of science writing, papers and theses, published reports, and video and audiocassettes. Correspondents include Earl Ubell, William J. Cromie, Pierre Fraley, Philip M. Boffey, Jane Stafford, and Herbert L. Nichols. Organizations mentioned include the American Association for the Advancement of Science and the Ford Foundation.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The National Association of Science Writers (NASW) is a professional society, established in 1934, serving science journalists and public information specialists. The Council for the Advancement of Science Writing (CASW), which was created in 1960, is a non-profit organization that sponsors various activities intended to improve the quality and quantity of information about science that reaches the public.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Records of the National Association of Science Writers and the Council for the Advancement of Science Writing include correspondence, membership records, financial records, domestic and international affairs material, newsletters, administrative material, working papers for seminars and workshops, samples of science writing, papers and theses, published reports, and video and audiocassettes. Correspondents include Earl Ubell, William J. Cromie, Pierre Fraley, Philip M. Boffey, Jane Stafford, and Herbert L. Nichols. Organizations mentioned include the American Association for the Advancement of Science and the Ford Foundation.
Also, oral history interview with Jane Stafford by Bruce Lewenstein, 1987.

controlaccess.corpname: American Association for the Advancement of Science.

Council for the Advancement of Science Writing.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: National Association of Science Writers and Council for the Advancement of Science Writing records, #4448. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

emph.ref: Series I. Series I. General files
Series II. Series II. International Affairs
Series III. Series III. Dometic Affairs

unittitle.extref: Link to a copy of the printed finding aid. PDF file.

scopecontent.p: Not all the material in the collection is covered by the above guide.

This collection was originally compiled without series. A later addition was split into International Affairs material and Domestic material, thus Series II and Series III were created. Everything listed under Series I represents the original list and may contain material that belongs in Series II and III.
